Articles.Content:
My kerbal is Crashes during Screen change

Hangar(any) to LaunchPad

space to hangar

and etc.

During the flight, ship Edit nothing happens, the game work like a charm

I'm sure it's some mod conflict, but I can not quite understand the game logs

 

logs files at

https://www.dropbox.com/s/tbm6owephhfht49/2016-01-22_234346.zip?dl=0

Your log files suggest you are running out of memory: 

Error occurred at 2016-01-23_001654.
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.exe, run by João Ricardo.
77% memory in use.
0 MB physical memory [1797 MB free].
0 MB paging file [1325 MB free].
0 MB user address space [66 MB free].
Write to location 00000000 caused an access violation.

How much physical RAM does your computer have?

Sorry, I forgot to put specifications 

 

Windows 10(64 bits) 

AMD fx 8xxx

Radeon 7750

8gb of memory

You should also add the output_log.txt in your archive if you think you have conflicting mods. You'll find it here:

Quote

KSP_win64\KSP_x64_Data\output_log.txt (64bit)

On 26/01/2016 at 10:40 PM, Benoit Hage said:

You should also add the output_log.txt in your archive if you think you have conflicting mods. You'll find it here:

 

i dint find a 64 bits folder

but i find that on x86

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ot7jw3yienm705g/output_log.txt?dl=0

It seems indeed you are running out of memory. Line 119485 

OutOfMemoryException: Out of memory
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) object:__icall_wrapper_mono_array_new_specific (intptr,int)

Try to install that mod: Active Texture Management

Or hold on until 1.1 is out and you will be able to use your 8GB.

but 64-bit version was confirmed with the new version of unity?

I know that the unity 5 this much more stable with 64 bits than in previous versions,

but have not seen any developer note about a 64-bit version
